title: Lorry driver shortages: 'Driving lorries is a bit like riding horses'
description: What is it like to be a new lorry driver in an industry experiencing severe shortages?

title: 'We didn't call ourselves mum and dad for 10 months'
description: Nina and Steven fostered a baby hoping in vain to adopt her. With a second baby they finally became parents.

title: Unboxed: Oil rig in lido to form part of UK-wide arts event
description: The decommissioned North Sea platform will relocate to Weston-super-Mare as part of 2022's Unboxed.

title: China: The patriotic 'ziganwu' bloggers who attack the West
description: Their scathing posts have shot them to fame amid rising nationalist fervour - but they toe a fine line.

title: Cladding: 'We're paying to live in a dark, dull box'
description: A Birmingham tower block resident, where combustible cladding is being removed, explains his plight.

title: The four-year-old footballer scouted by Arsenal while still at nursery
description: Zayn Ali Salman is the youngest-ever recruit to Arsenal's pre-academy.

title: The remote British island that's still Covid-free
description: The territory of St Helena, which has remained coronavirus-free, wants a big rise in tourists.

title: Russian inmate who leaked torture videos alleges death threats
description: Sergey Savelyev is seeking asylum in France after he leaked videos showing abuse in Russian prisons.

title: Queen cancels Northern Ireland visit on medical advice
description: Buckingham Palace says she has "reluctantly accepted medical advice to rest for the next few days".

title: Calls for nightclub searches after Nottingham needle spiking reports
description: A student who believes she was jabbed in a club says she has been left feeling "violated".

title: COP26: Russia's Vladimir Putin will not attend climate summit
description: No reason was given for the Russian leader's decision not to attend the conference in Glasgow.

title: Manager Bruce leaves Newcastle after takeover
description: Manager Steve Bruce leaves Newcastle United by mutual consent just 13 days after the Saudi Arabia-backed £305m takeover of the Premier League side was completed.

title: Covid: Bring back rules amid rising cases, urge NHS chiefs
description: But the business secretary says it is not time for "Plan B" and he wants to avoid further lockdowns.

title: Syria war: Deadly bomb blasts hit military bus in Damascus
description: At least 14 people are reported to have died in the bloodiest attack in the Syrian capital in years.

title: 12 uncapped players in Scotland squad for autumn Tests
description: Scotland include 12 uncapped players in their 42-man squad for the Autumn Nations Series.

title: Women's safety: Police video calls to verify Met officers
description: Dame Cressida Dick announces a new system for the Met after the kidnap and murder of Sarah Everard.

title: Five arrested after Man City fan attacked in Belgium
description: Five people are arrested after a Manchester City fan was attacked following Tuesday's Champions League game at Club Bruges.

title: Facebook and Instagram remove 'magician' who incited murder
description: A BBC investigation had previously exposed the occultist's influence on the killer of two sisters.

title: Lekki toll gate shootings: Nigeria's 'massacre without blood or bodies'
description: The BBC investigates what happened on the night 20 October 2020, when the Nigerian army opened fire on peaceful protesters in Lagos.

title: Willy Wonka songwriter Leslie Bricusse dies aged 90
description: The British songwriter was also behind hits such as Feeling Good, Talk to the Animals and Candyman.

title: Facebook fined a record £50m by UK competition watchdog
description: The CMA says the social media giant, which also may be changing its name, deliberately broke rules.

title: Tips on how to save energy at home and help the planet
description: What can homeowners do to reduce their energy consumption?

title: People won't have to pay more to go green, says Kwarteng
description: The business secretary denies that individuals will have to pay more to have a greener lifestyle.

title: NBA: 'One-man wrecking crew' Giannis Antetokounmpo stars as Bucks beat Nets
description: Watch some of his best moments as "one-man wrecking crew" Giannis Antetokounmpo stars for the Milwaukee Bucks during their victory over the Brooklyn Nets on the opening night of the NBA season.

title: Is the UK's green plan enough to halt climate change?
description: Support for roads, aviation and fossil fuel drilling could undermine UK's green credentials at COP26.

title: Kevin Sinfield: Rugby legend to undertake new Motor Neurone Disease charity run
description: Kevin Sinfield is to undertake another run for Motor Neurone Disease research after raising over £2.7m by completing seven marathons in 2020.

title: 'I had to change that talk in my head' - how Thompson-Herah made history in Tokyo
description: Elaine Thompson-Herah on how prayer, music and a list on her phone helped tame the demons to help her claim a historic sprint double in Tokyo.

title: Climate change: Fossil fuel production set to soar over next decade
description: Government plans to extract coal, oil and gas are incompatible with safe temperatures, says the UN.

title: The world's most famous basketball court gets a facelift
description: Harlem's legendary Rucker Park basketball court receives a major makeover.

title: Noisy: Rock band recovered their stolen kit after spotting it online
description: Rock group Noisy had around £25,000 of musical equipment stolen from their van in Walthamstow.
